website_summaries.verdict: The lightweight, flexible, and low-profile construction of the New Balance Minimus 40 Trainer made it a comfortable workout shoe for various aspects of cross-training. It was also considered sturdy enough for moderate weightlifting.
pros: A considerable number of users admired the versatility of the Minimus 40 Trainer
it worked well for all aspects of CrossFit WODs, HIIT workouts, weightlifting, and short running sessions
Many people enjoyed the low-profile midsole which helped them feel grounded and stable throughout the workout
The trainer was described as lightweight by the majority purchasers
A good number of wearers lauded the grippy and durable Vibram outsole
Multiple wearers agreed that the shoe feels comfortable on the foot
The style and color options of the product delighted most customers
cons: A handful of buyers experienced durability issues after only a few weeks of using the trainer
some of them wrote that the outsole unit detached from the upper, while others griped about the ripped upper
Several users found the sole unit too cushiony for heavier squats and deadlifts

customer_reviews.title: Without a doubt the best gym trainers
customer_reviews.text: Without a doubt the best gym trainers. There comfy perform well and are good for all lifting as well as short runs for circuits. Compared to the nano 7's these are much better.
